attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thunderstorm
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, Zapdos does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

ability.name: Curse
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Transparency
ability.text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is Asleep.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If your opponent has fewer than 3 Benched Pokémon, do the damage to each of them.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Strange Behavior
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to Slowbro as long as you don't Knock Out Slowbro. This power can't be used if Slowbro is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Krabby and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

cards.name: Energy Search
text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

ability.name: Transparency
ability.text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is Asleep.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

ability.name: Toxic Gas
ability.text: Ignore all Pokémon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Golbat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Golbat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Cowardice
ability.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may return Tentacool to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to Tentacool.) This power can't be used the turn you put Tentacool into play or if Tentacool is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

cards.name: Mr. Fuji
text: Choose a Pokémon on your Bench. Shuffle it and any cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Lapras but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage this way.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

ability.name: Prehistoric Power
ability.text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Kingler.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove a damage counter from Slowpoke. This attack can't be used if Slowpoke has no damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Scavenge
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Slowpoke in order to use this attack. Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Gambler
text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Flip a coin. If heads, draw 8 cards. If tails, draw 1 card.

cards.name: Recycle
text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card in your discard pile on top of your deck.

ability.name: Prehistoric Power
ability.text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

ability.name: Step In
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack) if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Lapras but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage this way.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Thunderstorm
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, Zapdos does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

attacks.name: Terror Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Golem does 100 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Weezing does 60 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hide in Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shellder during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Energy Conversion
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. Gastly does 10 damage to itself.

ability.name: Transform
ability.text: If Ditto is your Active Pokémon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokémon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokémon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokémon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

ability.name: Step In
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack) if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If your opponent has fewer than 3 Benched Pokémon, do the damage to each of them.

ability.name: Transform
ability.text: If Ditto is your Active Pokémon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokémon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokémon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokémon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Graveler (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

ability.name: Toxic Gas
ability.text: Ignore all Pokémon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Kabuto Armor
ability.text: Whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to Kabuto (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack only does half the damage to Kabuto (rounded down to nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Kabuto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

ability.name: Clairvoyance
ability.text: Your opponent plays with his or her hand face up. This power stops working while Omanyte is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Omanyte but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seadra.

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Grimer during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Zubat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Zubat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

cards.name: Mysterious Fossil
text: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play. (Major text change in Legend Maker. Requires reference.)
